args:
The prince uses Chronos's power in an attempt
to change the past. Hoping to prevent his
father's transformation, he returns to the day
the king went to the Binding Ruins. But before
he can save him, a mysterious man calling
himself Audric ends up interfering.
So I say to you once more, my liege:\nI have come to see your wish realized.
The power to pass through time\nand change the past...
I could save Zethia with that.\nI could save EVERYONE.
After my father changed, the Empire\nplunged this land into chaos and ruin.
Is it possible for me to change that?\nCan I really return this kingdom to a\ntime of peace once more?
All should be possibleâ€”dependent upon\nyour actions, of course.
However, this is not a thing to undertake\nlightly, for altering the past inevitably\nbrings changes to your own present.
You could end up creating a world far\ndifferent from what you intended.
...Or even a future that brings your\nown death.
I understand the risks are great...
But if I can save all those peopleâ€”if I can\nsave Zethiaâ€”then the risks are worth it!
Chronos, I want to do this.\nPlease lend me your power!
Your wish is my command, my liege.

Now then, I would have you call to mind
the time you wish to revisit. This act will
allow us to trace back the chain of
causality and cross time itself.
Well, here I am at the Dragon Choosing.\nNo matter what might await me,\nI WILL see my mission through!
It's time to find the legendary dragon!
I don't think I'll ever get used to\nwatching myself like this.
This is the day I set out on my journey\nto obtain a Sacred Shard.
And the day my father left\nfor the Binding Ruins.
That was when he changed.\nAnd I want to stop that from happening.
In that case, we would do well to move\nwith all speed, before the chain of\ncausality pulls us back.
It is impossible to remain forever in a\ntime period that is not your own.
Forgive me Your Majesty, but this plan?\nI must object. Your proposal is perilous\nin ways you cannot even conceive.
I know, Delphi. The sites that hold the\nSacred Shards are places that were\ndefiled by the great war of old.
Then why attempt to remove the Shards\nfrom the locations they protect?
The Sage King. You are called this, yes?\nAnd yet your actions here call the veracity\nof this laudable term into question.
Your face is that of a young lad, but the\nkeen edge of your words befits one of\nmore advanced years.
And will my warning go unheeded because\nyou think me a mere child?
You are a Tutelaryâ€”a member of the tribe\nthat has long protected the Sacred Shards.\nI would be a fool to ignore your words.
That's my father! I have to stop him!
Aurelius must be surrendered to the\nflow of time at this juncture.
You must let Aurelius enter the Binding\nRuin. That is the way time must flow.
No matter what you may know about his\nfuture, I cannot permit you to interfere\nwith his fate.
For now, you may call me...Audric.
I am a knower of truthâ€”a truth\nthat is yet unknown to you.
Okay, you know what? It doesn't matter.\nI'm going to stop my father here and now,\nand I don't care what you think about it.
If I don't do this, something horrible\nis going to happen to him!
And I will do what I must to stop you!
If it's a fight you want, I'll give it to you!
Your swordsmanship is strong, yet graceful.\nHowever...
What?! It's like he already knows\nhow I fight!
The strength you wield now is not nearly\nenough to achieve your desire!
If you cannot defeat even me, how do you\npropose to change the flow of time itself?!
Yield, Prince. Yield and go forth in search\nof power, that you might gain the strength\nyou need in the coming times.
I don't need you to remind me of my own\nweakness; I've thought of nothing else\nsince the day I let Zethia's hand slip away.
That's why I can't give up!
I fear we cannot remain in this moment\nany longer, my liege.
You are out of time, Prince.
If you still intend to cast off the yoke of\ncausality, you must think well.
Think on the meaning of your actionsâ€”and\non your readiness to accept what diverting\nthe flow of time will beget.
